intro: Euryops strictus, commonly known as the rigid bushveld daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows as a shrub with wiry, branching stems and narrow, hairy leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, blooming in spring and summer. Euryops strictus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
